definition: that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver

sentences.english: That's a long way off but it's not too early to make plans.
sentences.chinese: 儘管來日方長，但是及早打算總沒錯。

sentences.english: I'm your Aunt Monica. Yes, I am.
sentences.chinese: 賓，我是你姑姑摩妮卡，沒錯。

sentences.english: That's true.And more Chinese step on the cover of "Times".
sentences.chinese: 沒錯，而且越來越多的中國人登上了時代週刊封面。

sentences.english: That's right,Nigel. I think we can keep cost down .
sentences.chinese: 一點也沒錯，奈傑爾，我們認爲花費可以降低。

sentences.english: Because your life was transformed by this letter of acceptance, ? right?
sentences.chinese: 因爲你的人生被這封錄取信改變，沒錯吧？

sentences.english: Yes, only a rat puppet beat them out.
sentences.chinese: 沒錯，只有一個老鼠木偶打敗過他們。

sentences.english: And, yes, I mean one of our parties.
sentences.chinese: 還有，沒錯，我說的是政黨之一。

sentences.english: Water, yeah. They're seedy, aren't they?
Yes, he is a gigantic egotistical overrated artist.
sentences.chinese: 沒錯，他是一個極度自負的卻被高估的演員。

sentences.english: I was right--later on I found out the car was stolen.
sentences.chinese: 我還真是沒錯，後來我才發現那輛車是偷來的。

sentences.english: Yep, going right back to the Bronze Age.
sentences.chinese: 沒錯，可以直接追溯至銅器時代。

sentences.english: "Well, " said Tyrion, "a maester does not need a cock. "
sentences.chinese: “沒錯，”提利昂說，“學士纔不需要老二呢。”
你可能說的沒錯，外地人先生。

sentences.english: It was right then I started thinking about Thomas Jefferson…
sentences.chinese: 沒錯，我很盡看，於是我開始考慮傑弗遜起草的。

definition: Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
